setup.menu_constants module

setup.menus module

setup.menus.get_player_name(settings: DifficultyData | None, selected_wizard: WizardData) → str[source]

Prompt the player to enter their name and validate the input.

Parameters:

  • settings (DifficultyData | None) – Game settings, used for display mode.

  • selected_wizard (WizardData) – The data object for the selected wizard.

Returns:

The validated player name.

Return type:

str

setup.menus.initialize_player_info(settings: DifficultyData, current_session_player_name: str | None) → tuple[str, WizardData][source]

Initialize player name and selected wizard based on game mode.

In Heart Points mode, allows wizard selection. In No Heart Points mode, uses a default wizard.

Parameters:

  • settings (DifficultyData) – Game settings.

  • current_session_player_name (str | None) – Player name from current session, if any.

Returns:

Player name and selected wizard.

Return type:

tuple[str, WizardData]

setup.menus.run_difficulty_menu() → DifficultyData[source]

Display the difficulty selection menu and return the chosen difficulty settings.

Returns:

A DifficultyData object for the chosen difficulty.

Return type:

DifficultyData

setup.menus.run_heart_points_menu() → DifficultyData | None[source]

Display the initial menu to select the game mode (Heart Points or No Heart Points).

Returns:

DifficultyData for No Heart Points mode, or None for HP mode.

Return type:

DifficultyData | None

setup.menus.run_main_menu() → DifficultyData | str[source]

Run the main menu loop for Heart Points mode.

Returns:

DifficultyData if “Start Game” is chosen, EXIT_GAME_MARKER if “Exit Game”, otherwise loops for leaderboards.

Return type:

DifficultyData | str

setup.menus.select_character_menu(settings: DifficultyData | None) → WizardData[source]

Display the character selection menu and handle user navigation and selection.

Parameters:

settings (DifficultyData | None) – Game settings, possibly None or DifficultyData.

Returns:

The selected wizard’s data object.

Return type:

WizardData

setup.menus.select_from_menu(options: list[str], title: str = '+.+.+.+ Menu +.+.+.+', *, show_main_title: bool = False) → str[source]

Display a vertical text-based menu and handle user navigation and selection.

Parameters:

  • options (list[str]) – List of menu option strings.

  • title (str, optional) – Title to display above the menu. Defaults to “+.+.+.+ Menu +.+.+.+”.

  • show_main_title (bool, optional) – Whether to display the main game title. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The selected menu option.

Return type:

str

setup.word_selector module

setup.word_selector.filter_exact_length_words(words: list[str], exact_length: int) → list[str][source]

Return a list of words with exactly the specified length.

Parameters:

  • words (list[str]) – The list of words to filter.

  • exact_length (int) – The required word length.

Returns:

Words with the exact specified length.

Return type:

list[str]

setup.word_selector.filter_words_up_to_max_length(words: list[str], max_length: int) → set[str][source]

Return a set of words with length less than or equal to max_length.

Parameters:

  • words (list[str]) – The list of words to filter.

  • max_length (int) – The maximum allowed word length.

Returns:

Words with length up to max_length.

Return type:

set[str]

setup.word_selector.find_valid_word_with_subwords(exact_max_length_words: list[str], min_subword_length: int, min_subwords_needed: int, valid_subword_set: set[str]) → tuple[str | None, list[str] | None][source]

Find a word of a specific length with enough valid subwords.

Parameters:

  • exact_max_length_words (list[str]) – Words of the required length.

  • min_subword_length (int) – Minimum length for subwords.

  • min_subwords_needed (int) – Minimum number of subwords required (including the word itself).

  • valid_subword_set (set[str]) – Set of valid words for subword checking.

Returns:

The chosen word and its subwords, or (None, None) if not found.

Return type:

tuple[str | None, list[str] | None]

setup.word_selector.generate_word_list(difficulty_conf: DifficultyData, lexicon_path: str) → tuple[str | None, list[str] | None][source]

Generate a middle word and a list of subwords for the game board.

Reads the lexicon, filters words based on settings, finds a suitable middle word with enough subwords, and returns them.

Parameters:

  • difficulty_conf (DifficultyData) – The difficulty settings for the game.

  • lexicon_path (str) – Path to the word list file.

Returns:

The chosen middle word and a list of subwords, or (None, None) if failed.

Return type:

tuple[str | None, list[str] | None]

setup.word_selector.get_valid_word_subwords(word: str, valid_words_set: set[str], min_length: int) → list[str][source]

Find all valid subwords/anagrams of a word from a set, with minimum length.

Parameters:

  • word (str) – The word to find subwords for.

  • valid_words_set (set[str]) – Set of valid words to check against.

  • min_length (int) – Minimum length for subwords.

Returns:

List of valid subwords (excluding the original word).

Return type:

list[str]

setup.word_selector.read_word_file(word_path: str) → list[str][source]

Read a lexicon file and return a list of cleaned, lowercase words.

Parameters:

word_path (str) – The path to the word file.

Returns:

A list of words from the file, cleaned and lowercased.

Return type:

list[str]

Module contents

Setup package for Worderly.

This package contains modules for initializing game settings, menus, word selection, and grid generation.

Modules:

menu_constants: Constants used in game menus. menus: Functions for displaying and handling game menus. word_selector: Functions for selecting and filtering words for the game. grid_generator: Subpackage for generating and validating the word grid.
